name: The Block
title: Data Insights Openseas Market Share Surges Over 70
text:
Synopsis
The crypto market is experiencing a period of low activity and reduced trading volumes, with notable developments in NFT marketplaces and retail trading platforms signaling potential shifts in market dynamics.

Key Insights
- Ethereum network transaction fees have dropped 70% week-over-week to $0.77, reaching their lowest level since July 2020
- Opensea's NFT marketplace volume share surged from 25.5% to 71.5%, driven by the announcement of its $SEA token
- Robinhood's crypto revenue jumped 490% in Q4 2024 to $360 million, representing nearly 40% of its total quarterly revenue
- Coinbase reported Bitcoin comprised 27% of its trading volume, with Ethereum at 10% and other crypto assets at 48%
- Doodles NFT collection launched a Solana-based memecoin $DOODS, following a trend of NFT projects expanding to alternative blockchain platforms
- BTC and ETH futures trading volumes declined significantly (42% and 55% respectively) following a major liquidation event triggered by geopolitical announcements
- The crypto market appears to be in a cautious, low-volatility phase after recent significant market disruptions
